P109804.project_name: Access to Finance and Capacity Building of Earthquake-Affected MSEs in Yogyakarta and Central Java

project_abstract.cdata: The overall objective of the Access to Finance and Capacity Building for Earthquake-Affected Micro and Small Enterprises Project is to contribute to the Government's of Indonesia's initiatives to support the recovery of Micro and Small Enterprises (MSEs) in Yogyakarta and Central Java and enable them to reach at least pre-earthquake capacity through enhanced access to finance and targeted technical assistance. There are six components to the project. The first component of the project is assessment for identification of interventions/targeting beneficiaries. Under this component the International Organization for Migration (IOM) will conduct livelihood, market and environmental surveys in order to fine-tune the implementation strategy for assistance to Micro and Small Enterprises (MSEs). The second component of the project is asset replacement. Under this component, IOM will purchase goods and provide them as in kind support to restore infrastructure and physical assets that are essential for operations of MSEs, such as production facilities, livelihood tools, irrigation systems, small roads, warehouses, sheds, pens, and other essential small-scale infrastructure. The third component of the project is access to finance. Under this component, small loans will be provided to MSEs, including community enterprises, associations, cooperatives, etc. The fourth component of the project is assistance for market access. Under this component the project will finance Technical Assistance (TA) to help MSEs recover former buyers and customers or to identify new ones. The fifth component of the project is capacity building technical assistance. Under this component, the project will invest in TA and training for skills development and capacity building for the MSEs.
